onboarding.title: How we use push notifications
onboarding.headerSlideTwo: Unbiased reporting, cutting through the noise
onboarding.descriptionSlideOne: Our editorial team and topic experts source and read the best articles from global publishers, carefully curating your daily news brief.
onboarding.descriptionSlideTwo: A 360 view and array of different perspectives, giving you the fact-based context to understand this complex world.
onboarding.descriptionSlideCategories: This will be used to get personalized results and stories for you

notificationBulletPoints.descOne: Our skilled editorial team screens and selects the top articles of the day.
notificationBulletPoints.descTwo: Emerging updates and new topics will be provided for you on a rolling basis, every day.
notificationBulletPoints.descThree: We are constantly improving our product. We will keep you posted on new improvements and features.

tracking.title: Improve your experience
tracking.info: We track the behavior of our users to better understand their needs and to improve performance. Please consider allowing tracking for an enhaced experience.

tutorial.dailyBriefSnackBarText: 👋🏻 **Welcome to your Daily Brief!** Here you’ll get updates from our editorial team on the most important topics of the day.
tutorial.topicSnackBarText: 👍🏻 **You’ve found a topic of interest.** Scroll down to get an overview or jump into the list of articles we curated for you.
tutorial.exploreSnackBarText: 🔍 **If you’d like to explore more** or missed a brief then you can find even more topics as well as articles here.
tutorial.topicTooltipText: 🎉 Informed voices, who are all experts in their fields. They put together topics exclusively for informed.
tutorial.mediaItemTooltipText: 👉🏻 Dive deeper? Our editorial team carefully curates a selection of articles to give you a 360° perspective on the topic.
tutorial.profileSnackBarText: 💚 **Save articles and topics for later** – so that you can read or listen to your top picks whenever it suits you best.

settings.privacyPolicyContent:
This is a placeholder text!!! PRIVACY PLACEHOLDER We strongly believe that algorithms alone cannot deliver you the best news curation -at least for now. And we believe in the power of serendipity. This is why the curation of the articles you see is done by real human-beings. 

Our small and dedicated editorial screens extensively the most reliable sources every day - and creates the readlists with the most relevant content for you. 

By this process, we make sure that we can break filter bubbles, provide you with a wide range of perspectives and always show you the bigger picture behind the most important news day.

Our small and dedicated editorial screens extensively the most reliable sources every day - and creates the readlists with the most relevant content for you.

article.otherBriefs: More Articles and Deep Dives from Today

owner.editorBio: We are a group of dedicated journalists who have written for a variety of respected publications and bring decades of combined experience. Although we have different backgrounds, we believe in a common cause: breaking through filter bubbles and providing readers with the facts and variety of perspectives they need to understand a complex world.

howDoWeCurateContent.label: How do we curate content
howDoWeCurateContent.title: How do we curate content?
howDoWeCurateContent.text:
We don't believe algorithms alone can provide you with the news and information you need. That's why, in addition to using algorithms for what they're good at, we have human beings curate our readlists, experienced journalists who can provide you with the context you need to understand a complex world.

We select our articles from sources with a proven track record of following ethical practices and standards in journalism, and we clearly delineate between news, opinion, and analysis.

When the publications or authors we curate have a particularly strong political leanings, we mention that political perspective in the editor's note so the reader understands the biases they are encountering.

On occasion, we may use sources outside the standard realm of journalism, including blogs and academic articles. When we do so, we will clearly inform readers in the editor's note and highlight any political affiliations associated with the sources.

One of our central goals is to repair a splintered media landscape in which people remain in information bubbles, getting news from sources that only reinforce their existing beliefs.

We therefore believe firmly in providing a common platform where a variety of perspectives can be heard and hope, by doing so, we can help renew civil discourse and counteract ever-greater polarization.

We do not shy away from engaging with the most hotly discussed topics of the day. However, we seek to stay above the fray, presenting multiple points of view. While we strive to be non-partisan, this does not mean we don't have our own voice or believe there are some limits to acceptable discourse. We will not lend a platform to those who intentionally spread misinformation or question established science. We will exclude sources that peddle propaganda or seek to foment hatred.
